author: danielrachi
content:
Hi everyone! Has anyone tried to build a standard for writing node documentation in the past?
I'm talking about a formal "spec" that indicates what kind of docs to write and how to organize them.

author: mariohavel
content: Not sure if there is a framework for writing client specific docs. There are many general documentation practices you can/should look into, Piper was mentioning exactly that in the call yesterday. But speaking of Eth clients, as any other software, there needs to be covered usage, best practices from high level and then lower level developer docs. Each client has elaborate docs and I would check those to identify what you find missing or confusing. Then there are general, cross-client docs, for example I wrote those for running node on ethereum org, tried to fit all important info there but it's all high level..
